name: 1,1,1,3,3,3-hexadeutero-2-propanone
Reason: 1,1,1,3,3,3-hexadeutero-2-propanone has a melting point that is influenced by its structural components relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The basic unit, propanone, has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius. The deuterium atoms increase the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, contributing approximately +2 degrees Celsius each. The presence of six deuterium atoms can also increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +12 degrees Celsius.
